review_title: Come work for the Best team in Manalapan NJ
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Memory Care Director in Manalapan, NJ
pros:
Coworkers
Appreciated by Management and Residents
Training
Promotions from within Company
Benefits
Compensation
cons: None that come to mind

pros: Hours 8-4:30 Benefits No career advancement
cons: You work by yourself Pay sucks

pros: Looking for a new place to work at.
cons: Told me it is a nice place with enough time to care for my residents. But instead we have to do jobs we didn't sign up for. We can't get to everyone all the time. The boss talks about us negatively with other managers. This place just opened and my director of nursing already left and now I need to get used to a new person. Pretended like everything is nice but it is not. Going to be leaving here.

review_title: It was ok for first job management sucked tho
pros:
- (At the time) pay above minimum wage
- hour shifts
- free food
cons:
- old people are grouchy
- management didn't know how to manage

review_title: Bosses don’t care, work of 2 people
pros:
- Sign on bonus
- Some of my coworkers are nice 
- Easy to find
cons:
- I have to do the job of two or three people most times
- Too many people to take care of by myself.
- I get in trouble when I can’t get to everyone quick enough because I have to work by myself and do the job of 2 people. 
- They don’t care about the workers or the patients. 
- The bosses barely help us when we struggling, they are in the offices.

pros: Adds benefits for insurance plan and residents are super friendly
cons: Management is extremely lazy when it comes to staffing and their communication and transparency is just laughable.

pros: It is not a good place to work
cons: The management is not good to work for

pros: The residents are why we do this
cons: Management is a joke! They think they are corporate

review_title: Springpoint senior living in Skillman (Stonebridge at Montgomery ) is a a great place to work.
pros: They appreciate the employees, the pay is adequate, and the food is out of this world!
cons: Low annual salary increase even with a great employee review. 2 percent raise is the highest increase you can get each year.

pros: nice building nice coworkers free parking
cons: awful leadership not connected to reality

job_title: Assistant Executive Director/Administrator in East Windsor, NJ
pros: Great opportunity for entry level, but toxic management and typical office politics with catty drama always ends up overwhelming good staff to burnout and leave.
cons: Toxic office politics. A lot of favoritism among key leadership and management team. If you’re not a pushover you will be fired.

pros: Flexible, ok hours, nice coworkers
cons: Many conditions of flexibility, short-staffed, not enough pay, management is terrible

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Denville, NJ
pros: None at all. Terrible people
cons: Everything was bad and they are terrible

pros: I've worked for Springpoint for more than five years. It is a great organization that is really committed to helping employees grow and develop. They offer a lot of opportunities for training and tuition reimbursement, which is great. I've had the opportunity to attend a number of conferences and seminars that have helped me improve my skills. People here are really nice.  Our time-off benefits are generous and the organization is very good about work/life balance. The commitment to our residents and our communities is apparent in the work we do.
cons: There are limited amenities close to the corporate office.

pros:
Company seems to be concerned about seniors, but also treats employees well.
I work at corporate- it's a very welcoming atmosphere.
Been here almost 3 months. I am very happy with salary and benefits. 
We are actually not allowed to talk about Springpoint on social media, which is why you don't see a lot of reviews here.
I am actively looking for other positions so I can refer friends to work here.
cons: Only a Wawa to get lunch, but you do get an hour to venture to Neptune for more.

pros: Nice Environment, Clean Building, Actually love the job but can make the same money working at McDonalds
cons: Salaries are the reason for so much turn over in employees...how can people live on $14-$15 an hour in 2020....Management should try.

pros: Worked there for 5 almost 6 years. Enjoyed it for the culture and the residents.
cons: Union workers for my department didn't care for you and didn't want to help. HR was horrible and didn't like to work. Didn't listen or help resolve issues and gave a lot of push back. They don't really care about their employees and were shady.

pros: Good benefits.  Christmas bonus is nice when you work there long enough.
cons: Poor management.  I only work there for a month. They had me to a task that I was not trained to do, and should of been trained. I made complained and no satisfaction. I was let go anyway for unsatisfied performance.  The way I was treated was not reasonable.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in East Windsor, NJ
pros: Great coworkers, great residents. Really good atmosphere. Beautiful grounds. It's not a bad place to work.
cons: Administration cares more about resident satisfaction than ability to do your job. Initial pay is great but raises are minimal. Not a lot of room for growth.

pros: improved the nursing home a lot from the last company that owned it, job is easy to pick up, work with other young people
cons: cycled through managers, issues with working with shortage of workers

review_title: The healthcare facility I've worked in
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Hightstown, NJ
pros: Good benefits and people.
cons: The work can be really difficult and the care plans can be unclear. Weekends can be understaffed.

pros: The residents are wonderful to work for. They become your family.
cons: Management doesn't care about it's employees.

review_title: Positive atmosphere in a beautiful setting.
job_title: Resident Concierge in Red Bank, NJ
pros: Teamwork among all departments. Positive environment.
cons: Inadequate yearly salary increase. Low hourly payrate

job_title: Resident Services Coordinator in Somerset, NJ
pros: Friendly staff, every building is clean and updated
cons: Not much opportunity to advance

pros: If you love the elderly
cons: There are no cons at the moment

pros: The residents you get to know
